trans-unit.source: DocumentDB access control concepts
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB access control concepts

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB provides first class concepts in order to control access to DocumentDB resources.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB provides first class concepts in order to control access to DocumentDB resources.

trans-unit.source: For the purposes of this topic, DocumentDB resources are grouped into two categories:
trans-unit.target: For the purposes of this topic, DocumentDB resources are grouped into two categories:

trans-unit.source: In the context of these two categories, DocumentDB supports three types of access control personas: account administrator, read-only administrator, and database user.
trans-unit.target: In the context of these two categories, DocumentDB supports three types of access control personas: account administrator, read-only administrator, and database user.

trans-unit.source: The rights for each access control persona are:
trans-unit.target: The rights for each access control persona are:

trans-unit.source: Account administrator: Full access to all of the resources (administrative and application) within a given DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: Account administrator: Full access to all of the resources (administrative and application) within a given DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: Read-only administrator: Read-only access to all of the resources (administrative and application within a given DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: Read-only administrator: Read-only access to all of the resources (administrative and application within a given DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: Database user: The DocumentDB user resource associated with a specific set of DocumentDB database resources (e.g. collections, documents, scripts).
trans-unit.target: Database user: The DocumentDB user resource associated with a specific set of DocumentDB database resources (e.g. collections, documents, scripts).

trans-unit.source: There can be one or more user resources associated with a given database, and each user resource may have one or more permissions associated with it.
trans-unit.target: There can be one or more user resources associated with a given database, and each user resource may have one or more permissions associated with it.

trans-unit.source: With the aforementioned categories and resources in mind, the DocumentDB access control model defines three types of access constructs:
trans-unit.target: With the aforementioned categories and resources in mind, the DocumentDB access control model defines three types of access constructs:

trans-unit.source: Master keys: Upon creation of a DocumentDB account, two master keys (primary and secondary) are created.
trans-unit.target: Master keys: Upon creation of a DocumentDB account, two master keys (primary and secondary) are created.

trans-unit.source: These keys enable full administrative access to all resources within the DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: These keys enable full administrative access to all resources within the DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.target: DocumentDB master keys illustration

trans-unit.source: Read-only keys: Upon creation of a DocumentDB account, two read-only keys (primary and secondary) are created.
trans-unit.target: Read-only keys: Upon creation of a DocumentDB account, two read-only keys (primary and secondary) are created.

trans-unit.source: These keys enable read-only access to all resources within the DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: These keys enable read-only access to all resources within the DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB read-only keys illustration
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB read-only keys illustration

trans-unit.source: Resource tokens: A resource token is associated with a DocumentDB permission resource and captures the relationship between the user of a database and the permission that user has for a specific DocumentDB application resource (e.g. collection, document).
trans-unit.target: Resource tokens: A resource token is associated with a DocumentDB permission resource and captures the relationship between the user of a database and the permission that user has for a specific DocumentDB application resource (e.g. collection, document).

trans-unit.source: Overview of DocumentDB resource tokens
trans-unit.target: Overview of DocumentDB resource tokens

trans-unit.source: You can use a resource token (by creating DocumentDB users and permissions) when you want to provide access to resources in your DocumentDB account to a client that cannot be trusted with the master key.
trans-unit.target: You can use a resource token (by creating DocumentDB users and permissions) when you want to provide access to resources in your DocumentDB account to a client that cannot be trusted with the master key.

trans-unit.source: Your DocumentDB master keys include both a primary and secondary key, each of which grants administrative access to your account and all of the resources in it.
trans-unit.target: Your DocumentDB master keys include both a primary and secondary key, each of which grants administrative access to your account and all of the resources in it.

trans-unit.source: Exposing either of your master keys opens your account to the possibility of malicious or negligent use.
trans-unit.target: Exposing either of your master keys opens your account to the possibility of malicious or negligent use.

trans-unit.source: Likewise, DocumentDB read-only keys provide read access to all resources - except permission resources, of course - within a DocumentDB account and cannot be used to provide more granular access to specific DocumentDB resources.
trans-unit.target: Likewise, DocumentDB read-only keys provide read access to all resources - except permission resources, of course - within a DocumentDB account and cannot be used to provide more granular access to specific DocumentDB resources.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB resource token provide a safe alternative that allows clients to read, write, and delete resources in your DocumentDB account according to the permissions you've granted, and without need for either a master or read only key.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB resource token provide a safe alternative that allows clients to read, write, and delete resources in your DocumentDB account according to the permissions you've granted, and without need for either a master or read only key.

trans-unit.source: Here is a typical design pattern whereby resource tokens may be requested, generated and delivered to clients:
trans-unit.target: Here is a typical design pattern whereby resource tokens may be requested, generated and delivered to clients:

trans-unit.source: A mid-tier service is set up to serve a mobile application to share user photos.
trans-unit.target: A mid-tier service is set up to serve a mobile application to share user photos.

trans-unit.source: The mid-tier service possesses the master key of the DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: The mid-tier service possesses the master key of the DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: The photo app is installed on end user mobile devices.
trans-unit.target: The photo app is installed on end user mobile devices.

trans-unit.source: On login, the photo app establishes the identity of the user with the mid-tier service.
trans-unit.target: On login, the photo app establishes the identity of the user with the mid-tier service.

trans-unit.source: This mechanism of identity establishment is purely up to the application.
trans-unit.target: This mechanism of identity establishment is purely up to the application.

trans-unit.source: Once the identity is established, the mid-tier service requests permissions based on the identity.
trans-unit.target: Once the identity is established, the mid-tier service requests permissions based on the identity.

trans-unit.source: The mid-tier service sends a resource token back to the phone app.
trans-unit.target: The mid-tier service sends a resource token back to the phone app.

trans-unit.source: The phone app can continue to use the resource token to directly access DocumentDB resources with the permissions defined by the resource token and for the interval allowed by the resource token.
trans-unit.target: The phone app can continue to use the resource token to directly access DocumentDB resources with the permissions defined by the resource token and for the interval allowed by the resource token.

trans-unit.source: When the resource token expires, subsequent requests will receive a 401 unauthorized exception.
trans-unit.target: When the resource token expires, subsequent requests will receive a 401 unauthorized exception.

trans-unit.source: At this point, the phone app re-establishes the identity and requests a new resource token.
trans-unit.target: At this point, the phone app re-establishes the identity and requests a new resource token.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Each DocumentDB user has a PermissionsLink property which can be used to retrieve the list of permissions associated with the user.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Each DocumentDB user has a PermissionsLink property which can be used to retrieve the list of permissions associated with the user.

trans-unit.source: A DocumentDB permission resource is associated with a DocumentDB user.
trans-unit.target: A DocumentDB permission resource is associated with a DocumentDB user.

trans-unit.source: Each user may contain zero or more DocumentDB permissions.
trans-unit.target: Each user may contain zero or more DocumentDB permissions.

trans-unit.source: A permission resource provides access to a security token that the user needs when trying to access a specific application resource.
trans-unit.target: A permission resource provides access to a security token that the user needs when trying to access a specific application resource.

trans-unit.source: There are two available access levels which may be provided by a permission resource:
trans-unit.target: There are two available access levels which may be provided by a permission resource:

trans-unit.source: All: The user has full permission on the resource
trans-unit.target: All: The user has full permission on the resource

trans-unit.source: Read: The user can only read the contents of the resource but cannot perform write, update, or delete operations on the resource.
trans-unit.target: Read: The user can only read the contents of the resource but cannot perform write, update, or delete operations on the resource.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] In order to run DocumentDB stored procedures the user must have the All permission on the collection in which the stored procedure will be run.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] In order to run DocumentDB stored procedures the user must have the All permission on the collection in which the stored procedure will be run.
